pros: Lovely people to surround yourself with

AIESEC prepares you for your personal and professional life.

pros:
Great culture
Lots of learning opportunities 
Hands on practical work
A great support system to rely on
cons: Work-study balance is difficult to maintain

review_title: MCVP Experience at AIESEC in Pakistan
pros: The working environment is very productive when working in the National Team. You get to lead one whole portfolio of the organization where you have immense space for creativity. You get to work with people all over the world which helps you develop a global perspective. You attend different national & international conferences which enables you to further develop yourself and create life-long connections. The working dynamics are entrepreneurial in a way that benefits a lot if you have plans for running a startup later in life. The culture of the organization is clan and adhocracy type which encourages team collaboration and creativity.
cons: Sometimes you need to overwork which affects your work-life balance. Since the role is one year long, so it gives you a short window to carry out long-term projects.

pros: encourages teamwork and leadership a lot

review_title: A perfect place to widen your horizons
pros: Inclusive, diverse, turns you into self-aware global citizens
cons: Too time consuming. Could be difficult managing studies with the work. No pay.

review_title: AIESEC Pakistan MC gives you in-depth training of advanced level management with international and domestic exposure.
job_title: Vice President Finance & TM in Karāchi
pros: It will challenge you, make you do things out of the box, make you learn new ways and process improvements and it will provide you with an exceptional leadership experience
cons: There is no one department or a specific job description to work for. You should be ready to learn and deliver almost everything.

review_title: It is what you make of it
pros: They usually attract the brightest minds in each region they operate in. Also, gives you a lot of exposure interacting with with people from other Local Committees
cons: There can be a lot of politics once it comes to entering the Executive Body.

review_title: Truly brings out the leader within you
pros:
-Working with a talented, cooperative and hardworking team.
-Professional environment with emphasis on member development.
-Reasonable expectations and demands from members.
cons: If you're really dedicated and vested in the organization, you'll have to set aside a reasonable portion of your routine.

pros:

- Provides a lot of different opportunities
- Provides international exposure.
cons: Could be very time consuming at times.
